column5: Not mine.  I understand that is came off a downrigger 85' down on the U.S. side of Lake Ontario.   http://i1204.photobucket.com/albums/bb404/tennis_pwn/GoldFishDownRigger.jpg
wow don't see that everyday
wow. not in a million years.
btw, great setup on lake ontario!!
caught some of my biggest kings on orange spoons............
btw, great setup on lake ontario!!  Do you prefer that over a Spin Doctor and Fly?
Longer leader than I run.....that's why i don't catch goldfish
Do you prefer that over a Spin Doctor and Fly?  not usually, but that that combo has still caught lots of fish...
Saw a big one cruising Jordon Harbour  a few weeks back, thought it was a beer can in the weeds at first.

It wasn't unusual to see those that size and a bit larger along the shallower areas of the lakefront in Cleveland when I was a kid, I had no idea they would go that deep.  We never saw small ones, I am just guessing it would be pretty hard for them to hide from predators.

Wow!  I know wild goldfish can live quite comfortably in ponds and lakes but I would never have thought at 80 foot depths.  And chasing down a bait trolled at speed?  I dunno.. it sounds like a stretch.

I dunno.. it sounds like a stretch.  I think it's fairly common to catch a fish in 80 feet of water and then leave it on the hook until you get back to shore so you can snap a pic on the docks. Isn't it?
Well, i agree there...  that photo has obviously been Shirley'd

I think it's fairly common to catch a fish in 80 feet of water and then leave it on the hook until you get back to shore so you can snap a pic on the docks. Isn't it? LOL! A good point! At least it wasn't a rock bass?
Oh no

Becoming more common but......80'?  http://www.thestar.com/news/gta/2015/06/25/giant-goldfish-swarm-in-toronto-waters.html  http://file:///C:/Users/mtmca_000/Downloads/Goldfish_fact_sheet_web.pdf   I always thought that they would be an amazing Pike bait but I wouldn't risk using live ones.  Now salted ones....  Cheers, Mark
That's like "Finding Nemo" level of bizarre.  Holy cow.
I caught a 10 lb catfish on a burned double ten Muskie bucktail yesterday on St Clair. Not quite as weird as this but rather odd still.
The Star link has a chart showing goldfish caught while surveying. If I'm reading it right, they caught one in Pickering that was 3.5 pounds! That's a mighty big Goldfish!

The Star link has a chart showing goldfish caught while surveying. If I'm reading it right, they caught one in Pickering that was 3.5 pounds! That's a mighty big Goldfish! Some of the ones we saw in Lake Erie had to be 3-4 pounds, i don't think Lake Erie on this side has anything big enough to swallow one of those fatties!
confirmed.  this was just a fish story.  goldfish was netted in the harbour, and posed for the photo......
confirmed.  this was just a fish story.  goldfish was netted in the harbour, and posed for the photo......  Well d'uh!!
Ah Ha!  See!  You have to get up pretty early in the morning to put one over on the OFC'rs
